text: RT @corthorne: Now the River Pinn appears to be showing signs of pollution. Is there no end to the blight this monstrous project is visitin‚Ä¶

@corthorne @Feargal_Sharkey @Hillingdon @HS2ltd @stophs2 @EnvAgency @Andrew4Pendle @DSimmonds_RNP I'm from Uxbridge and remember the River Frays in the 70s spilling over the street in winter storms but it was foam not clean water from whatever domestic and industrial muck had been chucked in the river. From small boy netting and glass jar what fish survived often had fungus.

text:
RT @your_douglas: Plastic waste is not the only thing polluting our Rivers.
Are you aware that rivers are also being polluted with raw sewa‚Ä¶

@sunnyraisin62 @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency If they did hold their hands up, can you imagine the scale of compensation if all people with health problems can undeniably prove the link to their site? I'm hoping their silence means they're working hard to mitigate that...

@SianieRoo @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @MattHancock @BorisJohnson The news coverage is very welcome but they failed to get the message over that homes over 2 miles away are being badly affected. Staffs CC health official seems to be equally unaware when he advised us to close windows & open again when the stink has gone! They just don‚Äôt get it

I grew up living a few hundred metres from a landfill site in Sneyd Green in the 1990s and I don't remember ever even smelling anything from it, let alone being unwell. @RedIndustries2 maybe you could take some tips from how they did it in the olden days #stopthestink  @EnvAgency

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland You're so right. The people who have organised the campaigns and the community generally have been kind, supportive, and tireless in their advocacy and solidarity. I'll also be donating what I can afford and keep praying that an end to this horrendous situation is in sight [2/2]
RT @wallyhallpark: RT a thoroughly fantastic day spent with @scouseflowers looking at our meadows, talking seeds, resowing & community led‚Ä¶

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland We're 1.2 miles away and it's unbearable. I am breathing it in as we speak. I'm considering getting a purifier but they're really expensive and the burden shouldn't be on us: it shouldn't be an issue and we shouldn't be subjected to this poor level of air quality [1/2]

@LitterFreeTeam @MyDoncaster @EnvAgency Hi @LitterFreeTeam, Thank you for contacting us. Mill Dike is not a Canal & River Trust watercourse. This may fall to the responsibility of the local council. Regards  Sam.

text: @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @PHE_EoEngland I've just seen your tweet about having to increase your inhalers. How worrying and completely unacceptable. I am so sorry you and 1000s of people, animal, and the environment are being put at high risk on a daily basis.

Despite scientific papers on living close to landfills the @EnvAgency continue with lenient sanctions & @PHE_EoEngland remain embarrassingly silent on our health concerns. Action required now @MattHancock not next week or next month! @StinkStopthe @BBCPanorama https://t.co/RlT5Lfrt9I
